alert.note: Alert for Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:14PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 345 PM MDT... At 314 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Buffalo, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 279 and 294. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
